item.description: Shooting; INC#1236; 04:46PM; 800 block of N Eubank Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3DwASYy; Wilmington; Reported shooting with two patients (11-year-old male critical condition and 25-year-old female moderate condition) transported by LAFD firefighter-paramedics to a local trauma center. Unknown if this is connected to LAFD Inc # 1235. LAPD Inc # 3224. Nothing further.; FS 38; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC13 E285 E38 E49 RA101 RA38 RA79 T85; CH4; 13; Nicholas Prange

Shooting; INC#1235; 04:46PM; 1400 block of E Denni St; MAP: https://bit.ly/31qWwAB; Wilmington; Reported shooting with one patient (9-year-old female) transported by LAFD firefighter-paramedics to a local trauma center in moderate condition. Unknown if this is connected to LAFD Inc # 1236. LAPD Inc # 3240. Nothing further.; FS 38; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC6 E238 E49 RA112 T38; CH4; 12; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0928; 02:15PM; 2955 S Normandie Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3otnwYy; Adams-Normandie; Firefighters located fire in the walls and attic of a 3,003 sq-ft two-story multi-family residence built in 1905. Firefighters performed a coordinated effort between interior fire attack and rooftop ventilation. It took 47 firefighters 20 minutes to access, confine, and extinguish the flames, without injury. The cause of the fire is under investigation.; FS 15; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC1 BC11 BC13 CM22 E13 E15 E210 E215 E226 E26 E34 EA1 EM11 RA15 RA34 RA815 SQ21 T10 T15 T26; CH9; 12 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0928; 01:55PM; 2955 S Normandie Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3otnwYy; Adams-Normandie; Two-story duplex with heavy smoke showing. Offensive mode.; FS 15; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC1 BC11 BC13 CM22 E13 E15 E210 E215 E226 E26 E34 EM11 RA15 RA34 RA815 SQ21 T10 T15 T26; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0321; 12:04PM; 14335 W Sherman Wy; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Ip6uCS; Van Nuys; LAFD crews on scene of a law enforcement standby noticed smoke, and subsequently fire, coming from a third-floor unit of a three-story center-hallway apartment building at 11:40 AM, and upgraded the assignment to a structure fire response. Forty-two firefighters engaged in fire attack to confine the fire to the unit of origin, and extinguish the flames in 24 minutes, however smoke and water damage were more widespread than the fire damage. Firefighters assisted some residents with evacuation, and instructed others to shelter in place (remain in their unit with doors closed). One adult male patient in LAPD custody was transported to an area hospital with burn injuries. Several pets were affected: at least two felines deceased, others injured and fled, and one canine suffered smoke inhalation. Firefighters supported the canine until animal services arrived. The cause of the fire is under active investigation. MEDIA: PIO Firefighter David Ortiz is on scene for media needs. If media response will be delayed, please communicate that with LAFD Media Desk.; FS 81; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; AR1 BC10 BC12 CM42 E239 E290 E39 E81 E89 PI2 RA81 RA881 RA89 T39 T90 TL1 TM2 TM3; CH8; 12 18; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0321; 07:13AM; 14335 W Sherman Wy; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Ip6uCS; Van Nuys; LAFD has been on standby for a law enforcement operation, beginning several hours ago. A fire has developed in a 3-story center hallway apartment building. The scene has been deemed safe for LAFD to engage in offensive firefighting tactics in the building, where fire is showing from the third floor.; FS 81; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC10 BC12 CM42 E239 E290 E39 E81 E89 RA81 RA881 RA89 T39 T90 TL1 TM2 TM3; CH9; 12 18; Nicholas Prange

Grass Fire - Now Contained; INC#0944; 03:13PM; NB 5 Fwy x San Fernando Mission Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3rEfvlU; Mission Hills; Approximately two-acre grass fire burning uphill with light wind between Laurel Canyon and the Golden State Freeway. Crews have anchored the fire and deployed hose lines up the flanks to surround it. Forward progress has been stopped in approximately 20 minutes. No injuries. Cause under investigation. Nothing further.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 BC15 E18 E275 E287 E298 E7 E75 E87 E90 EM15 H2 H3 H4 HA2 HA3 HA4 RA88 T75 T87 T98; CH5; 17; Nicholas Prange

Traffic Collision; INC#1518; 10:04PM; 100 N Avenue 52; MAP: https://bit.ly/3dnZ1WG; Highland Park; Multi-vehicle collision with at least 4 patients, including at least two were reportedly pedestrians. No further details. Media Inquires: LAPD Central Traffic Division (Incident (4091+ 4094); FS 12; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 1; E12 E212 E44 RA12 RA55 T12; CH4; 12; Brian Humphrey

Rescue; INC#0517; 10:16AM; Sullivan Ridge Trail; MAP: https://bit.ly/3didLGn; Brentwood; LAFD ground and air response to a young adult male mountain bicyclist in fair condition with lower back pain after falling from his bike on a remote section of the Gape Sale Mountain Bike Trail near Sullivan Canyon. A hovering LAFD rescue helicopter will hoist him aboard, and LAFD flight Paramedics will provide in-flight care during direct transport to a regional trauma center.; FS 69; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; AO2 BC9 E69 H2 H4 HA2 HA4 RA69 RH114 T69; CH7; 12; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#0950; 02:30PM; 7319 N Hazeltine Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3ppEvu6; Van Nuys; 36 Firefighters took just 17 minutes to access, discover, confine and fully extinguish fire within the walls of one three-story unit (2 occupied floors over garage), in a residential condominium fourplex. One adult male civilian is being medically evaluated at scene by LAFD Paramedics for smoke exposure. His condition and likelihood for hospital transport was not specified. Though the precise cause of the fire has yet to be determined, the injured man (yet unknown if resident or worker) states he was performing plumbing 'hot work' when the fire erupted; FS 81; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC10 E288 E289 E290 E37 E7 E81 RA100 RA73 T88 T89 T90; CH9; 17; Brian Humphrey
